data.enText: any of the long threads that carry messages between the brain and parts of the body, enabling you to move, feel pain, etc.
the optic nerve
nerve cells
nerve endings

data.chText: 她的每一根神经都绷得紧紧的。
data.enText: Every nerve in her body was tense.
feelings of worry or anxiety

data.chText: 尽管已做歌手多年，他在演出前仍然神经紧张。
data.enText: Even after years as a singer, he still suffers from nerves before a performance.

data.chText: 我需要点东西来稳定一下我的情绪。
data.enText: I need something to calm/steady my nerves .
Everyone's nerves were on edge (= everyone felt tense ) .
He lives on his nerves (= is always worried) .
the courage to do sth difficult or dangerous

data.chText: 将这个公司告上法庭需要极大的勇气。
data.enText: It took a lot of nerve to take the company to court.

data.chText: 我想尝试一下跳伞，可到最后关头却没有勇气了。
data.enText: I was going to have a go at parachuting but lost my nerve at the last minute.

data.chText: 他鼓足斗志以6：4赢了最后一盘。
data.enText: He kept his nerve to win the final set 6–4.
a way of behaving that other people think is rude or not appropriate

data.chText: 真不知道你说了那些话以后怎么还有脸露面！
data.enText: I don't know how you have the nerve to show your face after what you said!

data.chText: 他还觍着脸跟我们借钱！
data.enText: He's got a nerve asking us for money!
‘Then she demanded to see the manager!’ ‘ What a nerve! ’
be a bag/bundle of nerves
to be very nervous
get on sb's nerves
to annoy sb
have nerves of steel
to be able to remain calm in a difficult or dangerous situation
hit/touch a (raw/sensitive) nerve
to mention a subject that makes sb feel angry, upset, embarrassed, etc.

data.chText: 你谈起他的第一个妻子，这就触到了他的痛处。
data.enText: You touched a raw nerve when you mentioned his first wife.
brass neck/nerve
a combination of confidence and lack of respect

data.chText: 我本以为她不会胆大妄为地去做了那件事。
data.enText: I didn't think she would have the brass neck to do that.
a war of nerves

data.chText: 神经战（利用心理压力摧毁对方的斗志）
data.enText: an attempt to defeat your opponents by putting pressure on them so that they lose courage or confidence
to give yourself the courage or strength to do sth

data.chText: 他鼓足勇气去约她出来。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He nerved himself to ask her out.
be a bag/bundle of nerves
to be very nervous
get on sb's nerves
to annoy sb
have nerves of steel
to be able to remain calm in a difficult or dangerous situation
hit/touch a (raw/sensitive) nerve
to mention a subject that makes sb feel angry, upset, embarrassed, etc.

data.chText: 你谈起他的第一个妻子，这就触到了他的痛处。
data.enText: You touched a raw nerve when you mentioned his first wife.
brass neck/nerve
a combination of confidence and lack of respect

data.chText: 我本以为她不会胆大妄为地去做了那件事。
data.enText: I didn't think she would have the brass neck to do that.
strain every nerve/sinew (to do sth)
to try as hard as you can to do sth
a war of nerves

data.chText: 神经战（利用心理压力摧毁对方的斗志）
data.enText: an attempt to defeat your opponents by putting pressure on them so that they lose courage or confidence

example: he had the effrontery to question my honesty
he kept fighting on pure spunk
you haven't got the heart for baseball

tr: any bundle of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body
get ready for something difficult or unpleasant

value.def: Nerves are long thin fibres that transmit messages between your brain and other parts of your body.

example.ex: ...in cases where the nerve fibres are severed.
example.tran: 在一些神经纤维被割断的病例中

value.def: If you refer to someone's nerves, you mean their ability to cope with problems such as stress, worry, and danger.

example.ex: Jill's nerves are stretched to breaking point...
example.tran: 吉尔的神经绷紧到了极点。

example.ex: I can be very patient, and then I can burst if my nerves are worn out.
example.tran: 我很有耐心，可如果我的承受力到了极限，我就撑不住了。

value.def: You can refer to someone's feelings of anxiety or tension as nerves .

example.ex: I just played badly. It wasn't nerves.
example.tran: 我只是打得很糟，不是紧张造成的。

value.def: Nerve is the courage that you need in order to do something difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: The brandy made him choke, but it restored his nerve...
example.tran: 虽说白兰地呛了他一下，却让他恢复了勇气。

example.ex: He never got up enough nerve to meet me.
example.tran: 他从没有足够的胆量来见我。

value.def: If you nerve yourself to do something difficult or frightening, you prepare yourself for it by trying to be brave.

example.ex: I nerved myself to face the pain.
example.tran: 我鼓足勇气去面对痛苦。

value.tran: 使鼓起勇气;使振作精神

value.def: If someone or something gets on your nerves, they annoy or irritate you.

example.ex: Lately he's  not done a bloody thing and it's getting on my nerves.
example.tran: 近来他没有干任何坏事，这让我心神不定起来。

value.def: If you say that someone has a nerve or has the nerve to do something, you are criticizing them for doing something which you feel they had no right to do.

example.ex: They've got a nerve, complaining about our behaviour...
example.tran: 他们竟敢对我们的行为表示不满。

example.ex: He had the nerve to ask me to prove who I was.
example.tran: 他竟敢要求我证明我自己的身份。

value.def: If you hold your nerve or keep your nerve, you remain calm and determined in a difficult situation.

example.ex: He held his nerve to beat Andre Agassi in a five-set thriller on Court One...
example.tran: 他镇定自若，在1号场地惊心动魄的5盘3胜对决中击败了安德鲁·阿加西。

example.ex: We need to keep our nerve now.
example.tran: 我们现在需要保持镇静。

value.def: If someone is living on their nerves, they are continually worried and anxious about the situation that they are in.

example.ex: Eileen, mother of three, had been living on her nerves for some considerable time.
example.tran: 艾琳是3个孩子的母亲，已有相当一段时间总是感到紧张不安。

value.tran: 紧张不安地度日;神经紧张

value.def: If you lose your nerve, you suddenly panic and become too afraid to do something that you were about to do.

example.ex: The bomber had lost his nerve and fled.
example.tran: 放炸弹的人没了胆子，逃之夭夭。

value.tran: 失去勇气;变得胆怯;惊慌失措

value.def: If you say that you have touched a nerve or touched a raw nerve, you mean that you have accidentally upset someone by talking about something that they feel strongly about or are very sensitive about.

example.ex: Alistair saw Henry shrink, as if the words had touched a nerve...
example.tran: 阿利斯泰尔看到亨利向后缩了一下，好像那些话触到了他的痛处。

example.ex: The mere mention of John had touched a very raw nerve indeed.
example.tran: 提到约翰就真的让人心痛。

trans: 视神经；奥酷纳；视觉神经；視神經；每条视神经
外周神经；周围神经；末梢神经；周边神经；神经
顏面神經；面神经；面神經；面部神经；颜面神经
坐骨神经；坐骨神經；坐骨神经损伤；坐骨神经线；坐骨神経
感觉神经；感官神经；知觉神经；纯感觉神经
交感神经；交感神經；交感神経；交感；受交感神经
三叉神经；三叉神經；三叉神经线；受三叉神经；三叉神経

partsOfSpeech.dec: nerv 神经 + ous …的 → 神经性的；紧张的
nerv 神经 + y …的 → 神经性的 → 易激动的
neur 神经 + al …的，具有…性质的 → 神经的
neur 神经 + itis 表炎症 → 神经炎
neur 神经 + ology …学 → 神经病学
neur 神经 + on 表物 → 神经元
neur 神经 + osis 表疾病 → 神经机能病
